docs.abstract: Airlines and pilots have been frustrated with the company’s handling of the crisis, including a bungled response to the two crashes.
docs.snippet: Airlines and pilots have been frustrated with the company’s handling of the crisis, including a bungled response to the two crashes.
docs.lead_paragraph: A charm offensive by Boeing to persuade airlines, crews and passengers to rally behind its 737 Max plane is already running into resistance.

headline.main: With 737 Max, Boeing Wants to Win Back Trust. Many Are Skeptical.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

byline.original: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

docs.abstract: Last year, investment bankers said the company could be valued at $120 billion upon its I.P.O. That number has declined in recent weeks.
docs.snippet: Last year, investment bankers said the company could be valued at $120 billion upon its I.P.O. That number has declined in recent weeks.
docs.lead_paragraph: Over the past decade, Uber changed urban transportation, disrupted entrenched taxi industries, defied regulators the world over and beat back questions about how it was altering the nature of work.

headline.main: Uber’s Stock Disappoints, Capping a Rocky Path to Its I.P.O.
headline.print_headline: Uber’s Rocky Ride to Its I.P.O. Ends in Stock Hitting the Skids

docs.abstract: Hemanth Kappanna’s research helped plunge Volkswagen into a scandal that continues to plague it. In February, he got two months’ pay and a one-way ticket to India.
docs.snippet: Hemanth Kappanna’s research helped plunge Volkswagen into a scandal that continues to plague it. In February, he got two months’ pay and a one-way ticket to India.
docs.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Hemanth Kappanna might seem like just another victim of corporate restructuring, a foreign worker whose skills were no longer needed, a middle-aged man with dashed American dreams.

headline.main: Six Years Ago, He Helped Expose VW’s Diesel Fraud. This Year, G.M. Let Him Go.
headline.print_headline: G.M. Lays Off an Engineer Who Helped Blow the Whistle on Volkswagen

docs.abstract: Stocks recovered on Friday as President Trump’s tariff increase on Chinese goods went into effect, but the S&P 500 dropped 2.2 percent this week.
docs.snippet: Stocks recovered on Friday as President Trump’s tariff increase on Chinese goods went into effect, but the S&P 500 dropped 2.2 percent this week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks rose Friday, snapping a four-day losing streak and bucking recent concerns about the trade war even after the Trump administration imposed fresh tariffs on imports from China and trade negotiations between Washington and Beijing ended with no announced deal.

headline.main: Wall Street Logs Its Worst Week This Year as Trade War Grows
headline.print_headline: Market Zigzags Between Gains and Losses

docs.abstract: Harry’s was founded nearly nine years ago. Edgewell’s oldest brand dates back more than a century.
docs.snippet: Harry’s was founded nearly nine years ago. Edgewell’s oldest brand dates back more than a century.
docs.lead_paragraph: When they founded Harry’s as a shaving start-up nearly nine years ago, Andy Katz-Mayfield and Jeff Raider sought to shake up a decades-old business dominated by two giants in the field.

headline.main: Shaving Start-Up Harry’s Will Be Sold to Owner of Schick for $1.37 Billion

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: Beijing could match what the United States does, and its options include upping the ante in untraditional ways. But most of its choices come with drawbacks.
docs.snippet: Beijing could match what the United States does, and its options include upping the ante in untraditional ways. But most of its choices come with drawbacks.
docs.lead_paragraph: A week ago, the United States and China looked as if they were going to reach a deal to end their trade war. Today, they are trying to salvage their many months of negotiations.

headline.main: Trump Could Raise Tariffs on China. Here’s How China Could Respond.

docs.abstract: Special teams dispatched by a number of manufacturers glean valuable information on what happens to vehicles and their occupants after a crash.
docs.snippet: Special teams dispatched by a number of manufacturers glean valuable information on what happens to vehicles and their occupants after a crash.

headline.main: Crash Scene Investigations, With Automakers on the Case

docs.abstract: Many organizations measure the effect of investments meant to spur positive change, but the metrics they use, and their results, vary. Several are trying to make it easier.
docs.snippet: Many organizations measure the effect of investments meant to spur positive change, but the metrics they use, and their results, vary. Several are trying to make it easier.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investing in companies or organizations that make a positive change on society can be a bit like indulging in a vice: A lot of people might enjoy it privately, but they’re not comfortable talking about it publicly.

headline.main: Investing for Social Impact Is Complicated. Here Are 4 Ways to Simplify It.
headline.print_headline: Making It Easier to See Your Money’s Halo

docs.abstract: A number of small companies are looking for ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. But investors, burned by the clean-tech boom a decade ago, are leery.
docs.snippet: A number of small companies are looking for ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. But investors, burned by the clean-tech boom a decade ago, are leery.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — With the money he made selling his last start-up to Google, Matt Rogers has been investing in companies that are trying to fight climate change.

headline.main: Start-Ups Hoping to Fight Climate Change Struggle as Other Tech Firms Cash In
headline.print_headline: In Silicon Valley, Little Appetite for Climate Tech

docs.abstract: A trade war that seemed to be on the brink of ending now appears likely to be prolonged as President Trump threatens to impose more tariffs on China.
docs.snippet: A trade war that seemed to be on the brink of ending now appears likely to be prolonged as President Trump threatens to impose more tariffs on China.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s top economic advisers on Monday accused China of reneging on previous commitments to resolve a monthslong trade war and said Mr. Trump was prepared to prolong the standoff to force more significant concessions from Beijing.

headline.main: Trump Advisers Accuse China of Reneging on Trade Commitments
headline.print_headline: U.S. Advisers Say China Is Reneging On Trade Accord

byline.original: By Ana Swanson and Keith Bradsher
